prompts.title: Perspective Correction Failure Analysis
prompts.description: Analyzes why a specific perspective correction technique failed on an image.

variables.name: technique_name
variables.description: The name of the algorithm used (e.g., homography_basic)

variables.name: failure_description
variables.description: Brief description of the observed failure

prompts.content:
You are an expert in Computer Vision and OCR. I have applied the '{{technique_name}}' perspective correction to an image, but it produced poor results: {{failure_description}}.

Please analyze the attached image and artifacts. Identify potential root causes such as:
1. Extreme vanishing points
2. Lack of clear line segments
3. Noise or blur interfering with edge detection

Suggest 2-3 alternative approaches or parameter adjustments.

prompts.title: New Experiment Planning
prompts.description: Helps structure a new experiment with clear hypotheses and metrics.

variables.name: goal
variables.description: The main objective of the experiment

prompts.content:
I am planning a new experiment with the goal: {{goal}}.

Help me structure this experiment by defining:
1. A clear, falsifiable hypothesis.
2. The specific variables (independent and dependent).
3. Success metrics (quantitative and qualitative).
4. A step-by-step execution plan.
5. Potential risks and mitigation strategies.

prompts.title: Interim Run Log – Negative Result
prompts.description: Guides the agent to produce a structured interim run log focusing on failure-mode migration and next steps.

variables.name: run_id
variables.description: Artifact or run identifier (e.g., timestamped batch id)

variables.name: hypothesis
variables.description: Hypothesis under test in this run

variables.name: prev_summary
variables.description: Brief summary of the previous run's result and dominant errors

variables.name: curr_summary
variables.description: Brief summary of the current run's result and dominant errors

prompts.content:
You are assisting with an OCR perspective-correction R&D workflow that tracks experiments using structured assessments.

We just completed a run with ID {{run_id}} under the hypothesis: {{hypothesis}}.

Previous run summary:
{{prev_summary}}

Current run summary:
{{curr_summary}}

Using the 'run-log-negative-result' template, draft an interim assessment that:
1. States the executive summary and verdict (whether the hypothesis is supported yet).
2. Compares failure modes between previous and current runs, emphasizing any migration in error types.
3. Highlights 2–3 representative samples (status-quo failure, new failure, partial improvement) and their implications.
4. Proposes 3 concrete next steps that are directly actionable in code or configuration.

Do not restate the full template; just fill the sections concisely so it can be pasted into the corresponding markdown scaffold.
